content.description:
The Barnet Smears are the collection of ice that can be found all along the creeks and dirt cirques of the north side of Burnaby mountain.

This is a bit of a choose your own adventure, so try to plan out your line in advance or end up bushwacking and lost within city boundaries.

There is some climbable ice we found at 49.282300, -122.929465 but getting there was not worth the effort. Supposedly the ice further East that you can see from the road is more easily accessible.

In any case, grovel your way up frozen sketchy dirt, bend some pick heads and end up on top of Burnaby Mountain with confused students looking at you as you wait for the bus with your climbing gear on since the descent back to the car would probably suck more than the climb did.


A couple screws, maybe some spectres for the dirt.

More of a hill, on the coldest winter days Burnaby mountain can form an interesting collection of icicles dripping off of eroding cirques of dirt that make for a bit of a novelty day out swinging tools into ice, frozen dirt, ferns, and logs.
